FuncDef: The display mpls rsvp-te sender command displays information about a Resource Reservation Protocol-Traffic Engineering (RSVP-TE) enabled interface as an RSVP TE sender.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the type and number of the interface that receives Path messages.
-

Displays information about RSVP-TE neighbor nodes on a specified interface.
-

Peer IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Examples: Local LSP ID: 1                 Session Tunnel ID: 300
Token bucket rate: 0            Token bucket size: 1000
Local LSP ID: 0                 Session Tunnel ID: 200
Token bucket rate: 0            Token bucket size: 1000
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The display mpls rsvp-te reservation command displays information about a Resource Reservation Protocol-Traffic Engineering (RSVP-TE) enabled interface as an RSVP TE sender.
